body.p: A container used to display the contents of a popup menu. When a menupopup is open, it floats above the window and may extend outside the window border. There are several ways in which a menupopup may be used:

ol.li: It may be placed inside a template.XULElem("menu"), template.XULElem("menulist"), template.XULElem("toolbarbutton"), or a template.XULElem("button") with the template.PrefAnch("a-", "type") attribute set to "menu" to create a popup that will open when the menu or button is pressed.
It may be attached to any element using the template.XULAttr("popup") attribute. When the element is clicked with the left mouse button, the menupopup will be displayed.

It may be attached to any element using the template.XULAttr("context") attribute. When a context menu is opened, the menupopup will be displayed. A context menu may be opened by right-clicking the element, or by pressing the menu key on the keyboard.

body.p: More information is available in the XUL tutorial and Popup Guide.

body.p: The following example shows how a menupopup may be attached to a template.XULElem("menulist").
body.pre: <menulist> <menupopup> <menuitem label="Mozilla" value="http://mozilla.org"/> <menuitem label="Slashdot" value="http://slashdot.org"/> <menuitem label="Sourceforge" value="http://sf.net"/> <menuitem label="Freshmeat" value="http://freshmeat.net"/> </menupopup> </menulist>
body.p: The following example shows how a menupopup can be used a context menu for an element. When the label is right-clicked, the menu will be displayed.
body.pre: <menupopup id="clipmenu"> <menuitem label="Cut"/> <menuitem label="Copy"/> <menuitem label="Paste"/> </menupopup> <label value="Right click for popup" context="clipmenu"/>
